result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle Y Jean Philippe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Supervision may be transferred to Maryland

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 07/17/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-4

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's during period of probation or civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, Emily R., without prior Court approval.
- Third party contact for the purpose of division of assets.
- Obtain/maintain employment and/or school.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review
*7/17/2015  STAYED for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Y Jean Philippe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michelle Y Jean Philippe in court with Attorney Eric Lowenberg.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Alicia Cruz also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.   mld

Defendant Michelle Y Jean Philippe in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2 (as charged): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of15 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Emily R., without prior court approval.  
* 25 hours of Community Service.
* Third party contact for the purpose of division of assets.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as  
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Supervision may be transferred to Maryland.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 7-17-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Michelle Y Jean Philippe in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-5-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court would allow parties to submit a stipulation to modify the no contact order to allow 3rd party contact.  All conditions of bail continue in full force, per the Court.   mld

Defendant Michelle Y Jean Philippe in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-10-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Emily R., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Michelle Y Jean Philippe appeared in court pro-se.  i.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant confirmed that she has hired Attorney Eric Lowenberg as defense counsel.  Attorney Eric Lowenberg appeared telephonically, and confirmed that he was hired as counsel to represent the defendant.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 1-30-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail, including no contact with Emily R., and no violations of the law, are continued until further order of the Court.   The victim was present and did not make a statement.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EMILY R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michelle Y Jean Philippe in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Michelle Y Jean Philippe in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
